titleStmt.title: An elegy on the Death of the Duke of Cambridge, which happened on the 12th of December 1677. being our shortest day of the year.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.D. for H. Brome.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Since solemn mourners the bright day-beams ..."
On the death of Charles Stuart, aged 5 weeks; first son of James Duke of York (James II) by his second wife; designated Duke of Cambridge but died before the patent passed; cf. G.E. Cokayne.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
